title.narrative: To establish, promote and support a new low-cost learning environment that encourages the emergence of literate, productive, healthy and responsible community members.

title.narrative: 3,120 communities distributed across the country with Learning Centers actively supported and managed by CDC/Community Learning Committees overseeing adult literacy and community education; 􀂄 Ministry of Education-based support structure of provincial and district literacy officers and village teachers trainers; 􀂄 Increased levels of literacy; productivity; health and civic consciousness in community members. 􀂄 30% of skills trained community members have new employment opportunities (18,000)
